results.name: Reverse one number (0), then two numbers (2,1), then three (5,4,3), then four (9,8,7,6), etc.
comment: A self-inverse permutation of the nonnegative numbers.
a(n) is the smallest nonnegative integer not yet in the sequence such that n + a(n) is one less than a square. [_Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Apr 06 2009]
Array T(n,k) = (n+k)^2/2 + (n+3*k)/2 for n,k >=0 read by descending antidiagonals.
Array T(n,k) = (n+k)^2/2 + (3*n+k)/2 for n,k >=0 read by ascending antidiagonals. (End)
